catalog.name: Protected Areas Database of the U.S. v2.0

items.name: National to county scale data - loads quickly and displays at zoom levels 1 to 13 (Cached Data Layers)
items.description: National to county scale data - loads quickly and displays at zoom levels 1 to 13 (Cached Data Layers)

items.name: PAD-US 2.0 Fee Boundary Overlaps (National Scale)
items.description: Use to identify overlaps between agency boundaries in the PAD-US 2.0 Fee simple parcel ownership layer. The assessment identifies all boundary overlaps, those between Federal agencies only (large and small), and those between Federal and State agency boundaries (large and small). Add assessment layer of interest separately.

items.name: All Overlap Errors  (National Scale)
items.shortReport:
Use to identify overlaps between agency boundaries in the PAD-US 2.0 Fee simple parcel ownership layer. The assessment identifies all boundary overlaps, those between Federal agencies only (large and small), and those between Federal and State agency boundaries (large and small). Please click �Add Data� to add the other assessment layers of interest.
Note: these data will not draw past a scale of 1:75,000. If you need city-level data, please click 'Add Data' above for access to the data catalog of Dynamic Data Layers.

items.name: Federal/Federal Overlaps Greater Than 5 Acres  (National Scale)
items.shortReport:
Use to identify overlaps between agency boundaries in the PAD-US 2.0 Fee simple parcel ownership layer. The assessment identifies all boundary overlaps, those between Federal agencies only (large and small), and those between Federal and State agency boundaries (large and small). Please click �Add Data� to add the other assessment layers of interest.
Note: these data will not draw past a scale of 1:75,000. If you need city-level data, please click 'Add Data' above for access to the data catalog of Dynamic Data Layers.

items.name: Federal/State Overlaps Greater Than 5 Acres  (National Scale)
items.shortReport:
Use to identify overlaps between agency boundaries in the PAD-US 2.0 Fee simple parcel ownership layer. The assessment identifies all boundary overlaps, those between Federal agencies only (large and small), and those between Federal and State agency boundaries (large and small). Please click �Add Data� to add the other assessment layers of interest.
Note: these data will not draw past a scale of 1:75,000. If you need city-level data, please click 'Add Data' above for access to the data catalog of Dynamic Data Layers.

items.name: All Overlap Errors  (National Scale)
items.shortReport:
Use to identify overlaps between agency boundaries in the PAD-US 2.0 Fee simple parcel ownership layer. The assessment identifies all boundary overlaps, those between Federal agencies only (large and small), and those between Federal and State agency boundaries (large and small). Please click �Add Data� to add the other assessment layers of interest.
Note: these data will not draw past a scale of 1:75,000. If you need city-level data, please click 'Add Data' above for access to the data catalog of Dynamic Data Layers.

items.name: PAD-US 2.0 DOD Boundaries  (National Scale)
items.shortReport:
Includes Department of Defense planning boundaries suitable for distribution in the public domain from PAD-US 2.0. Some sensitive sites are not included and internal ownership is not represented (but presumed Federal).
Note: these data will not draw past a scale of 1:75,000. If you need city-level data, please click 'Add Data' above for access to the data catalog of Dynamic Data Layers.

items.name: PAD-US 2.0 Proclamation and Other Planning Boundaries  (National Scale)
items.shortReport:
Includes boundaries that provide additional context by administrative agency name (for example, DOD, FWS, NPS, USFS) shown with an outline as internal ownership is not represented.
Note: these data will not draw past a scale of 1:75,000. If you need city-level data, please click 'Add Data' above for access to the data catalog of Dynamic Data Layers.

items.name: PAD-US 2.0 Public Access  (National Scale)
items.shortReport:
General level of public access permitted in the area - Open, Restricted (permit, seasonal), Closed, or Unknown from the combined PAD-US Inventory (local parks data gaps exist).
Note: these data will not draw past a scale of 1:75,000. If you need city-level data, please click 'Add Data' above for access to the data catalog of Dynamic Data Layers.

items.name: PAD-US 2.0 Protected Areas by Manager  (National Scale)
items.shortReport:
All protected areas classified by GAP Status Code protection level and manager type.
Note: these data will not draw past a scale of 1:75,000. If you need city-level data, please click 'Add Data' above for access to the data catalog of Dynamic Data Layers.

items.name: PAD-US 2.0 Protection Status by GAP Status Code  (National Scale)
items.shortReport:
A measure of management intent to permanently protect biodiversity or manage for multiple uses (including extraction) for all lands and marine areas in the combined PAD-US Inventory.
Note: these data will not draw past a scale of 1:75,000. If you need city-level data, please click 'Add Data' above for access to the data catalog of Dynamic Data Layers.

items.name: PAD-US 2.0 Federal Management Agencies  (National Scale)
items.shortReport:
Use to depict federal agency land managers or administrators (no state, local, or nonprofit lands) by name from the combined PAD-US inventory(includes designations, easements and marine). DOD Military Lands are shown with an outline as internal interests are not defined (but assumed Federal).
Note: these data will not draw past a scale of 1:75,000. If you need city-level data, please click 'Add Data' above for access to the data catalog of Dynamic Data Layers.

items.name: PAD-US 2.0 Manager Name  (National Scale)
items.shortReport:
Categorization by name, with detailed federal managers (BLM, NPS, USFS, etc.) and generic state/local/other managers from the combined PAD-US inventory (includes designations, easements and marine) with descriptions from the 'Agency Name' Domain, 'Manager Name' Field. DOD Military Lands are shown with an outline as internal interests are not defined (but assumed Federal).

Note: these data will not draw past a scale of 1:75000. If you need city-level data, please click 'Add Data' above for access to the data catalog of Dynamic Data Layers.

items.name: PAD-US 2.0 Manager Type  (National Scale)
items.shortReport:
Broad categorization of manager levels, for general depictions (Federal, State, Local, etc.) of who manages areas from the combined PAD-US inventory with descriptions from the 'Agency Type' Domain, 'Manager Type' Field.
Note: these data will not draw past a scale of 1:75,000. If you need city-level data, please click 'Add Data' above for access to the data catalog of Dynamic Data Layers.

items.name: PAD-US 2.0 Protection Mechanism Category  (National Scale)
items.shortReport:
Shows categories of land tenure for all protected areas, and also includes marine ares, proclamation, and other planning boundaries from the combined PAD-US inventory.
Note: these data will not draw past a scale of 1:75,000. If you need city-level data, please click 'Add Data' above for access to the data catalog of Dynamic Data Layers.

items.name: PAD-US 2.0 Federal Fee Managers (Authoritative Data, National Scale)
items.shortReport:
Describes federal administrative agencies from the 'Manager Name' field. Includes fee simple parcels (where available) from authoritative data sources from PAD-US 2.0 Fee feature class (no designations, easements, or marine). DOD Military Lands shown as an outline as internal land ownership is not represented (but implied Federal).
Note: these data will not draw past a scale of 1:75,000. If you need city-level data, please click 'Add Data' above for access to the data catalog of Dynamic Data Layers.

items.name: PAD-US 2.0 Fee Managers  (National Scale)
items.shortReport:
Standardized administrative agency or entity name (USFS, BLM, State Fish and Wildlife, State Parks and Rec, City, NGO, etc) from the 'Manager Name' field. Includes fee simple parcels (where available) from the PAD-US 2.0 Fee feature Class only (no designations, easements or marine).
Note: these data will not draw past a scale of 1:75,000. If you need city-level data, please click 'Add Data' above for access to the data catalog of Dynamic Data Layers.

items.name: Local scale data - loads more slowly and displays at zoom levels 14-20 (Dynamic Data Layers)
items.description: Local scale data - loads more slowly and displays at zoom levels 14-20 (Dynamic Data Layers)

items.name: PAD-US 2.0 Fee Boundary Overlaps (Local Scale)
items.description:
Use to identify overlaps between agency boundaries in the PAD-US 2.0 Fee simple parcel ownership layer. The assessment identifies all boundary overlaps, those between Federal agencies only (large and small), and those between Federal and State agency boundaries (large and small). Add assessment layer of interest separately.
Note: these data only draw at the city level and take time to load. High performance, national scale data services are available in the map.
